titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, king of England, Scotland, France & Ireland, defender of the faith, &c., to all and singular archbishops, bishops, archdeacons, deanes, and their officials ... to whome these presents shall come, greeting whereas we are credibly giuen to vnderstand, that by reason of grieuous visitation in this time of the great contagion of the plague amongst our poore subiects ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, king of England, Scotland, France & Ireland, defender of the faith, &c., to all and singular archbishops, bishops, archdeacons, deanes, and their officials ... to whome these presents shall come, greeting whereas we are credibly giuen to vnderstand, that by reason of grieuous visitation in this time of the great contagion of the plague amongst our poore subiects ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: And by the Assignes of Iohn Bill,

notesStmt.note: "Witnes Our selfe at Copt-hall, the seuenth day of October, in the twelfth yeere of Our Reigne."
